revised_title: Foraminifera Distribution in the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans
tldr: This article examines the distribution and characteristics of Foraminifera, a type of marine plankton, in the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. The authors discuss the differences in fauna between the deep-sea and shallow-water regions, as well as the impact of cold currents and icebergs on the distribution of Foraminifera in the Arctic Province.
